properties.title: Illegal Parking at 300-399 NE 30TH AVE
properties.summary: Illegal Parking at 300-399 NE 30TH AVE
properties.comment: There is an RV (Oregon license # 50320) and purple/blue van (Oregon license # 261JKJ) and another purple/blue van (no plates) that are parked on the corner of NE 30th and Flanders St. There is also another van with windows completely covered that has been in our neighborhood (until recently, parked on 30th Ave, one block south). The owner of all these vehicles is clearly the same. He has a vicious bulldog that has on occasion attached neighborhood dogs. He is using the homeowner's water and electricity without permission. (Homeowner is Don Wright: 3006 NE Flanders St. Don has significent mental health issues.) This intruder is taking advantage of our unhealthy and vulnerable neighbor. Many neighbors are concerned for safety all around. Please do something to support his moving onto a different and better place.

Has not moved all week; no plates and trip permit #0084065 in the window expired 01 JUL 2019. properties.title: Illegal Parking at 200-299 NE 30TH AVE
properties.summary: Illegal Parking at 200-299 NE 30TH AVE
properties.comment: This RV has been parked at this location for over a week. There is another vehicle- a Plymouth Voyager van that has been in our neighborhood for over a year. The man who owns both of these vehicles has lived in them both. In addition he also owns 2 more Plymouth Voyager vans that are parked in front of 3006 NE Flanders St. This man is menacing and opportunistic. He is using my neighbor's water and electricity and tying is his dog up to the porch without the neighbor's permission. He has a vicious dog that has attacked 2 other dogs.This guy is taking advantage of my neighbor who has mental health issues and is vulnerable. We are concerned for our safety all around.Please do something to move him onto a different and better place.These vehicles are impeding vision when crossing the intersection of NE 30th and NE Flanders St. You have to go half way into the intersection in order to see if there is a car , bike, scooter or pedestrian coming. They are creating a safety hazard.

This creates visibility problems for cyclists and motorists alike, and also presents the obvious danger of dooring to cyclists. It would be great to address this consistent misuse of new infrastructure so that it doesn't spread and cause problems with this great new infrastructure. Thanks!
